title: Justice for the Gibeonites
summary: A famine leads David to seek God, who reveals it’s due to Saul’s unfaithfulness to the Gibeonites. David gives them seven of Saul’s descendants for justice. The chapter also recounts heroic battles against Philistine giants.

faq.question: Why was there a famine in Israel?
faq.answer: Because Saul had broken Israel’s oath to protect the Gibeonites.

faq.question: How was the situation resolved?
faq.answer: David gave the Gibeonites seven of Saul’s descendants, and the famine ended.
